Reviews.Title: “One of the worst rooms that I have stayed in”
Reviews.Author: Spurpur
Reviews.Content: Was "diverted" to this hotel for the night after the original hotel that I reserved was overbooked. This hotel was at the edge of Berlin and was a good 30 to 40 min taxi ride from the city centre. The service was OK but the rooms, that was a different story. The room was very run down and dirty. Stains on the chair; mini ancient TV; the mini fridge was actually missing; Rusty old showers; and the folder that contains information about the hotel was actually empty. The only marginally redeeming thing about this hotel is that it is right across from a S-Bahn Station and semi close to the Olympic Stadium. Would not stay here again even if it was free.

Reviews.Title: “Never again...”
Reviews.Author: Mehmetbugra
Reviews.Content: We stayed there two nights. There is only one positive thing about this hotel ; across the street there was a train station, so we could go to the city center easily. ( but it takes 25-30 minutes) Most of the rooms have a nice view but not spacious and unfortunately not clean enough. Also they need a serious refurbishment! We had terrible breakfasts for two days. The restaurant was closed for two days and you have to go out for dinner. No room service after 11:00. Even you can not find a glass of hot water. And the most important thing; They dont have any idea about "service business". They were like a soldiers. No smile, no kindness, just doing their simple tasks... If you are having a vacation, strongly avoid this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we'll be back”
Reviews.Author: johnbentley8
Reviews.Content: Booked though Flight Centre in London. Was excellent value. The hotel is directly opposite the s-bahn station and whilst being several stations from the Hauptbahnhof we found it a pleasant ride in-off peak times. It is an easy walk to Standau. The old Standau is a delight. The new Standau is as you would expect anything new to be. As for the visitor complaining that he couldn't find a pub to have a beer, he must have missed the one on the corner about 100 metres from the hotel with a delightful (non English speaking) host. The room was more than satisfactory and we found the breakfast quite adequate considering it was included in the more-than-satisfactory tariff

Reviews.Title: “Perfect out of town location”
Reviews.Author: Spandaubailey
Reviews.Content: The Senator might seem too far from the attractions of the city for a stay in Berlin but it is served by the S-Bahn immediately outside the hotel to anywhere you want to go. I stayed on the 13th floor overlooking Stresow S-Bahn station and had no problem with noise as some people have mentioned. The 16th floor is the restaurant with a panoramic wonderful view of Spandau and beyond. Staff were helpful and friendly with some English spoken and they were patient with my attempts at German! The old medieval town of Spandau and the ancient Zitadelle are a short walk away and well worth a visit. The Olympiastadion is just a couple of stops on the S-Bahn.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent staying at Hotel 'Senator'”
Reviews.Author: 0andriy
Reviews.Content: During the LinuxTag 2010 conference I was staying at "Senator" hotel with another speaker who also participated in the event. The meal on breakfast time was quite good, however the same on every day. The location is good (nearby to Berlin Spandau) if you don't mind to travel by S-Bahn or U-Bahn public transportation. Nevertheless I recommend this hotel to people, who would like to live out of downtown of Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but a bit far from downtown”
Reviews.Author: BangkokNegotiator
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in December 2008. The hotel has ok lobby service and very good restaurant. We were there for a working/sight seeing trip. In the cold of the winter, the room was nice, very clean and warm. Seems like a new hotel to us, or may be it was renovated. What we really liked was the breakfast. Better than what we expected, actually, it was very good with good service. Only complaint maybe that it is a good 30 minutes from the main shopping street by train (cost only 2.6euros). But this is not really a problem for me as I travel a lot in Europe and best way to save is to get a hotel that is a bit far away. If you have more budget, then getting a downtown hotel would be better.

Reviews.Title: “Nice But Nothing More”
Reviews.Author: oupsss
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel. Breakfast of good variety. Most of the stuff very polite and helpfull. Far from the centre and generally the location not very busy in the night. We hardly found a bar to have a beer. Clean.

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel's a fraud.”
Reviews.Author: bp_isere
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights there. Never seen such a poor breakfast, even in 2 stars hotels. Howerver, our room had a nice 12" TV back from the 80s. I even wonder whether the painting in the room, representing dying sunflowers, was ironic.

Reviews.Title: “Awfull, Dont go!!”
Reviews.Author: patataki
Reviews.Content: We were actually booked there by a travel agency taking us to a FAM trip. (these free trips travel organizers book to show their product..) The hotel is like 20-25 min away from any place in Berlin you could consider as center (if there is one!!) with the Sbaund, and the rooms NOT CLEAN,the walls paperwalls!, the food the worst i ve ever seen ;P - we only had a bite to ensure that it tasted as bad as it looked. The only good thing were the maids that were super polite as well as the guy in the reception that was super helpfull. Which actually, all these, dont make a stay there unforgettable - only in the negative terms.
